author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
A scheduled meeting between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Peoples Democratic Party president Mehbooba Mufti in New Delhi was called off last Saturday, despite a successful round of talks with BJP president Amit Shah.

According to top sources, talks resumed after the intervention of an emissary from the PM’s office. There were reports of arm-twisting by Ms. Mufti through posturing and hardening of positions by the BJP. However, the Modi-Mehbooba meeting on Tuesday saw a breakthrough.

Sources said Ms. Mufti faced a major crisis within the party, with legislators making remarks like “making the government with or without Ms. Mufti” and rebellion over facing fresh elections.

The government formation seems on course now with the PDP expecting no new negotiations on portfolios. “Union Finance Minister Arun Jaitley made it clear that nothing had changed since Mr. Sayeed’s death. We welcome the stand,” PDP leader Nayeem Akhtar said.

Most PDP leaders on Thursday refused to comment on the delay in government formation and progress made on Ms. Mufti’s demands.
title: Dissent in party may have forced PDP chief to act
